result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan C Overstreet Jr

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:09 AM Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a motion hearing to modify bond. 
Defense is seeking to transfer the bond from case 19CF671 to case 22CF564 or that the court will consider modifying the bond in this case to $7,000 cash bond with a $4,000 signature bond along with any other conditions the court deems necessary. Makes statements on the record. 
State does not object to the bond from case 19CF671 being moved to which ever case file the defense is seeking. The state does object to modification of the bond in case 22CF564 and provides arguments as to why. Asks that the motion to reduce bond in case 22CF564 is denied. 
BTC: Cases set for a joinder motion. Matter set over for trial as previously scheduled.
Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:30 PM Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled for a jury trial in 19CF671 today's date. 
State is moving to dismiss case 19CF671 and states why. Intends to move forward on remaining open cases. Has extended an offer on the three remaining cases. 
Defense does not object to dismissal of case 19CF671. Has filed a motion to join for remaining cases. Makes statements on the record. 
BTC: State's motion to dismiss case 19CF671 is granted. Motion to modify bond in remaining case files scheduled.

8:36 AM Attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr in court, in custody. Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
State indicates a speedy trial has been requested and ask for the court to proceed with trial in case 19CF671 case. Puts statements on the record and provides arguments regarding order in which to proceed with cases. 
Defense does not want to be in a position where two trials are set at the same time. Addresses concerns raised by the State. Puts statements on the record. 
BTC: 19CF671 will remain scheduled for trial in August 23, 2022. Remaining cases will be scheduled for JT and the trial that will be selected to proceed in October 2022 will be selected at next court appearance. Matter set over.
Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr. Court Reporter Donna Moore.
Arraignment on April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr appeared in court, Attorney Michael H. Kopp appeared in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State asks the court to take judicial notice of bond conditions in place at the time of offense.
Court takes notice.
State calls Investigator Bodnar.
Direct by the State for case 21CF1242
Defense on Cross.
Direct by the State for 22CF67
Defense on Cross.
Redirect by the State.
State moves for bind over on both cases.
Defense Objects bind over on both cases. On case 22CF67 defense moves for dismissal.
BTC: Probable cause found on both cases, Bound over on both cases.
Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim D.S. (person, property, residence or family). You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

10:06 AM Defendant Bryan C Overstreet Jr appeared in court, Attorney Michael H. Kopp appeared in court for Bryan C Overstreet Jr, Attorney Diane M. Donohoo appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense motions for dismissal; argument put on the record. The State objects; argument put on the record. Matter passed momentarily to allow the State to review the matter further.
Back on the record at 10:15 am. The State requests a modest amount of cash based on the continued violation of the no contact order. Defense objects and asks for signature bond.

BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. PC found.  Bond to be set at $5000.00 signature bond - same terms and conditions as other cases. Good cause found to waive time limits
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Deft indicates he has spoke with Attorney Kopp, requests this matter be adjourned for tomorrow. 
BTC: Matter Adjourned.
